PageTitle: peer as-path-filter import (BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view)
FuncDef:
The peer as-path-filter import command applies a routing policy based on an AS_Path list to filter BGP routes received from a specified peer.
The undo peer as-path-filter import command cancels this configuration. The peer as-path-filter import command applies a routing policy based on an AS_Path list to filter BGP routes received from a specified peer. The undo peer as-path-filter import command cancels this configuration. By default, no policy based on an AS_Path list is configured for filtering BGP routes received from a peer, and all the BGP routes will be received from the peer.
ParentView: BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an IPv4 peer address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the number of the AS path filter.
The value is a decimal integer ranging from 1 to 256.

Specifies the name of an AS_Path filter.
The value is a string of 1 to 51 case-sensitive characters. If spaces are used, the string must start and end with double quotation marks (").

ExtraInfo: To apply a routing policy based on an AS_Path list to filter BGP routes received from a specified peer, run the peer as-path-filter import command. This configuration allows the routes that do not match the policy to be filtered out.
